title: 820-02890-a 20v present but no ppbus
message: this board is look similiar to the a2485 logic board. It had a spill in the audio amp area (ur600, ur630 and ur660). the rest of it looks unbothered. f5200 and f5201 are reading 3v.  pp3v8_aon is 0v. this is very unusual since 20v is showing the usbc port meter

title: 820-02890-a 20v present but no ppbus
message: Remove F5200/1 and check C5250 voltage.

title: 820-02890-a 20v present but no ppbus
message: 12.4v on pin 1 on c5250.  the 20v on the meter is now 5v since i removed f5200/1

title: 820-02890-a 20v present but no ppbus
message: is voltage injection safe?

title: 820-02890-a 20v present but no ppbus
message: Check ohm resistance between PPBUS_AON and 3V8_AON.

title: 820-02890-a 20v present but no ppbus
message: 62.6k ohm

title: 820-02890-a 20v present but no ppbus
message:
If you get correct C5250 voltage, removing F5200/1, the problem is on the system side of PPBUS_AON power rail.
Check for short on all secondary power supplies.

title: 820-02890-a 20v present but no ppbus
message: is it safe to inject voltage on ppus_aon

title: 820-02890-a 20v present but no ppbus
message:
Why???
There is no short!

No reason to inject voltage in this case.
You must check all secondary power supplies.

title: 820-02890-a 20v present but no ppbus
message: so the short isn't on ppbus but it's on another one that's created with ppbus?

title: 820-02890-a 20v present but no ppbus
message:
That is, in theory.
Check first for short between PPBUS_AON and the output of all secondary power supplies connected to PPBUS_AON.

title: 820-02890-a 20v present but no ppbus
message: what does a short between ppbus_aon and the secondary rail going to look like? will there be very little resistance the two?

title: 820-02890-a 20v present but no ppbus
message: You should check the resistance between both rails; not to ground...

title: 820-02890-a 20v present but no ppbus
message: what range of resistance would denote a short on that rail

title: 820-02890-a 20v present but no ppbus
message:
We talk about a short BETWEEN TWO RAILS; not a short from a rail to ground.
You should get high reading in diode mode and OL in reverse way.

title: 820-02890-a 20v present but no ppbus
message: one of the secondary rails is shorted to ground?  another thing that i first noticed is that the amp meter will continue to reboot with the battery attached

title: 820-02890-a 20v present but no ppbus
message:
You may not have any secondary power rail shorted to ground.
But a short between PPBUS_AON and any secondary power rail, will block the board.

title: 820-02890-a 20v present but no ppbus
message: there is no schematic or boardview for this newer model.  the only area corroded was the audio amps. maybe removing ur600/630/660 is the answer?

title: 820-02890-a 20v present but no ppbus
message: Audio amps cause many times problems on main power rails, when affected by corrosion underneath.

title: 820-02890-a 20v present but no ppbus
message: how is it that 20v shows on the amp meter even thought 3v8_aon isn't there to power the pmu?

title: 820-02890-a 20v present but no ppbus
message: the ppbus is 12.4v for a split second then it drops to 5v and continues to drop dramatically down to 1.7v.  the amp meter stays at 20v 0.000a

title: 820-02890-a 20v present but no ppbus
message:
"smbus_batt_scl/sda is .222v"
Is that voltage reading (power applied to board), or diode mode reading (no power)?

BTW, do not write end "V" after diode mode readings...

title: 820-02890-a 20v present but no ppbus
message: that's voltage reading

title: 820-02890-a 20v present but no ppbus
message:
If PPBUS_AON is not maintained, you can't measure any other voltage on the board.

Remove F5200/1 and check if C5250 voltage is stable.

title: 820-02890-a 20v present but no ppbus
message: the 12 volts is stable with the fuses removed

title: 820-02890-a 20v present but no ppbus
message:
Looks like you have problems with a secondary power supply.
Start checking all of them in diode mode and voltage pulse on outputs.

title: 820-02890-a 20v present but no ppbus
message: how is it that 20v shows on the amp meter even thought 3v8_aon isn't there to power the pmu?

title: 820-02890-a 20v present but no ppbus
message: Connect another charger directly (without USB-C meter) and measure R5220 voltage.
